Package client.net

Class Sender

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • client.net.Sender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class Sender
extends java.lang.Thread
    Creates an instance of Sender using a given socket. A connection is made to the server from the specified socket.

    The constructor starts the run() method after variables are declared.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sender

        public Sender​(java.net.Socket socket,
              java.lang.String name)
        Creates an instance of Sender on a given socket with a clients name.

        Starts the run() method after variables are initialized.

        Parameters:
        socket - the socket bound to the client
        name - username chosen by the client

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This threaded method handles the output respectively a Chat message from the client.

        After a connection is established it constantly checks whether a user has typed a message in the cmd, then sends this message to the server with the clients name. When the client disconnects, a notification prompt is displayed.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • sendMessage

        public static void sendMessage​(java.lang.String message)
